page.title: 15PLAISTOW, HOUSES.
page.content: One of the oldest houses in Plaistow is{Todhurst Manor. }It has some very old features of stone with later additions of brick. It has a fine barn built entirely of of wood with a clay tiled roof. {Plaistow Place was built in 1620.}It was originally quite a small house, but has been added to over the years. Now it has eight bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen and four other rooms. It also has a clock workshop. In the cellar there are supposed to be tunnels to Loxwood, the church, and to another old house in Plaistow called "Quennels". {The Council Estate, built below Nell {Ball,}is thirty years old and consists of 30 houses and 12 flats. A group of 20 Polish people live there. They came over to Britain after the war.
